name: Chesford Grange - A QHotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found an offer on travel Zoo two days before travelling and called straight away to check availability. The offer was very good value and included breakfast on both morning and dinner on one night + tickets to Warwick Castle (which was added + as wan't planning on visiting but glad we did and it is expensive to visit, so this was a nice added touch).
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The person who took the reservation was very friendly, gave us tips on what to visit and travel time to our chosen places of visit.. very good first impression. We received a phone call the following day to offer to book the complimentary dinner in advance as the restaurant does get very busy.
reviews.title: Would highly recommend this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Service in the restaurant at dinner was very good even though they were busy and the food was very tasty.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel in lovely surroundings near plenty of interesting places

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would now look out for other Q hotels in the country depending on where we would like to visit next.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, comfortable room, disappointing food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Requested earlier checkin than 3pm and although this cannot be guarranteed, the room was ready on arrival. The nice surprise was the complimentary upgrade, the not so nice surprise was the car park view on the ground floor. The room was very modern, decent size as well as the bathroom. (proper hairdryer in the room as well unlike some hotels).
reviews.title: Just super!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: We stayed on the dinner package, the deluxe family room was large , clean & well equipped. The hotel has a very adequate pool but with the hotel full there were long lines waiting for a breakfast table (1/2 hour approx.) & the reception was small for the size of the hotel. The dinner fare/service was pretty standard but they had a great kids menu with all the kids food prepared fresh unlike much of the frozen/ready prepared kids food elsewhere. The hotel reception seemed undertrained & not terribly helpful & were unwilling to look in the phone book or more than once on the internet to find a local attraction. We would chose this hotel again given the location,rooms ,pool & nothing was really terrible ,although the restraunt & reception need expanding along with the expansion in room capacity..
reviews.title: impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted a romantic weekend away and picked this hotel based on the photo and the reviews. There are clearly 2 levels of rooms at the hotel and we got the standard room with no air con, minibar or table, which is ok if you expect that. It was disappointing for us and in a hot part of the hotel, making it difficult to sleep in the room. The main part of the hotel is wood panelled with a lovely atmosphere. The hotel staff are polite and courteous. We were told we were eating in The Grange with all the expectations that go with that , we were disappointed again, it was a 70's style extension with a garish carpet and canteen type tables, it reminded me of the holiday camps I went to as a child. The food was very good, unfortunately our waiter was in need of a bath and stood close enough for us to know. How do you deal with that without upsetting him and ourselves? The other dining area area was similaraly decorated and had a buffet in it. Beakfast was good (as long as you dont ask for anything - the waitress could not speak english very well).
reviews.title: Not as good as the photo, more like a travel lodge

likes.disliked: — Dining Room, Room quality, beauty spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: My wife booked a pedicure but did not enjoy it depite the excellent beautician as the foot bath was filthy.
reviews.title: Lovely room, good food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite the big moan about the hotel, we had a good time at the weekend, we drove 40 minutes to Solihull (Ackers) for a ski lesson and then another 40 minutes to the outskirts of Warwick for a clay pigeon shoot (adventure sports). Warwick is delightful and we ended our stay with dinner in Kenilworth (Diment) which was superb and a 25 minute walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: In summary if you are going to stay here get the upgraded room and dont expect everything to look like the photo (oh and bring your own tea bags- or take them from the bar area self service - they put the cheap horrible ones in the room)
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.title: Very good stay for the price

reviews.title: Ok
reviews.text: We were surprised how big this hotel was when we arrived....but it was ok for a one night stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were compact, and had undergone a recent refurbishment; the décor was quite modern and slick. Good clean bathroom and powerful shower. We used the leisure facilities, but felt the pool was too small for the number of guests staying. It was really busy with quite a few ‘noisy’ children @ 4pm, so it was not very tranquil for anyone who wanted to relax!
reviews.title: Superb Room/Bathroom

likes.liked: — Great bedroom and bathroom/ ecellent facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At 5pm, we phoned reception book our evening meal for 8.30pm and were astonished (and disappointed) to find out the restaurant was full!!!! We were not informed of this when we checked in (@ 2pm approx) and were quite shocked. After a couple of anxious phone calls, the staff did book us in to a restaurant in the nearby town of leamington spa. We did make a request for courtesy taxis to and from the restaurant for the inconvenience caused, which they honoured.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our 2nd stay at the Chesford Grange, and we went on both occasions for a relaxing weekend break and enjoyed both times equally. The hotel is set in lovely surroundings and has country walks to enjoy. We had evening meals in the restaurant which were top quality and the breakfast set us up for the day. If you want a relaxing break with attentive staff then is the hotel for you.
reviews.title: We loved it and will return again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Chesford Grange Hotel for 2 days in late June - it is in a beautiful rural setting ideal for trips to Leamington, Warwick, Stratford etc. From the moment we arrived we were impressed. The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were large and clean and the gym and pool were ideal for our requirements(2 teenagers). The food in the restauarant, the bar and the breakfast were all of an excellent standard and again the staff were excellent.. We felt overall, the hotel provided good value for money. We will definitely stay again and recommend to family and friends
reviews.title: Excellent Throughout

reviews.text: Great location nice, frendly and helpfull staff, Linzi at the Restaurant was the best she give us a frendly and warm service, excellent thanks from the whole group.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is comfortable and has everything you need however it is missing that something that you feel 4 stars should give you. It definitly feels like it is geared towards conferences - the benefit of this is the massive car park so no need to worry about parking when staying here. The room was fine and clean however bed was small, no air con or mini bar. It does provide a safe though which was good. We were unfortunate to be placed near an area of grass that is used for functions so we were woken on Saturday morning by workers building something.
reviews.title: Excellent definitely worth staying

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011
reviews.text: My wife would have used the spa but it was fully booked so if you are staying here and want to use it make sure you call in advance to book. Gym looked good however the pool looked small for such a large hotel.
reviews.title: Too expensive and a con

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good however the continental selection was lacking compared to other hotels we have stayed in - it was all help yourself which is expected for larger hotels. We were told that someone would come and get our order for tea/coffee but ended up having to ask, looked as if they were short staffed.
reviews.title: Mediocre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bar was comfortable and the prices were not to high which is good given you are not in walking distance of anything else really.
reviews.title: Excellent and friendly service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I last stayed here two years ago & there is no sign of any updating, the reception is in a terrible state with exposed fuse boxes, cracked glass & peeling paint. The family rooms are decent as is the restaurant, the pool is good and the staff generally very pleasant although there was never any answer from reception when I called from the room but this was probably due to understaffing rather than inefficiency. This is really now a conference hotel rather than a family destination and really needs some updating.
reviews.title: needs updating in some areas

aka: Chesford Grange - a q Hotel Kenilworth
description: Chesford Grange is a unique hotel based in Warwickshire. The historic charm oozes from every corner, from it's red roofed turrets and Tudor style exterior to the majestic splendour that awaits you inside. The hotel is set within 17 acres of countryside which is ideal for team building or indeed a leisurely stroll. Even though you may feel a million miles away, the hotel is near the M40 and M69, and is just 5 miles from Warwick Castle and 13 miles from Birmingham Airport.The hotel is home to state of the art conference facilities. There are 13 conference and meeting rooms with a total capacity of up to 700 delegates. For relaxation on the night the hotel is home to a relaxing leisure and spa.
